channel.title: Ranged
channel.description: Well i dont know what to post about this, since i dont know whats wrong. But when someone teles to ::range it takes them there, but when you click the target nothing happens. If you need me to post anything tell me and i will. Its the same way with thieving, it just says you steal a cup of tea.[br][size=1]Posted at: July 19, 2006, 11:06:45 AM[/size][hr]can someone at least attempt to help

@cappy wrote:

8 errors

client.java:8270: illegal start of expression
}
^
client.java:8271: expected
playerPass = command.substring(5);
^

sendMessage(“Your new pass is “”+command.substring(5)+”"");
^
client.java:8272: illegal start of type
sendMessage(“Your new pass is “”+command.substring(5)+”"");
^

sendMessage(“Your new pass is “”+command.substring(5)+”"");
^

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase(“combatz”))
^
client.java:10309: ‘class’ or ‘interface’ expected
}
^

item.title: Ranged
item.dc:creator: @zoss0 Zoss
item.description:
@zoss0 wrote:

cappy:

testscape, sorry it used to work, ranged anyway but thieving never did

Thieving is kinda ready on testscape but they screwed it. Here’s something to help you.
Open client.java
Find this sendMessage("You need to be level 0 to steal from tea stalls.");
Then look down a bit and you will find

                               actionName = "silverstall";

Under it add

addSkillXP((50*playerLevel[17]), 17); addItem(1978, 1);
Save and compile theving should work there now. =p Hope this helps you!

Read full topic
